snippet: The City Council speaker, Christine C. Quinn, supports a bid to change the city’s campaign finance rules that the Campaign Finance Board says would create gaping loopholes in the city’s regulations.
abstract: Christine C Quinn, City Council speaker and expected candidate for mayor in 2013, is supporting a change to New York City’s campaign finance rules that would significantly expand the ability of unions, corporations and advocacy groups to spend money on behalf of local candidates.
lead_paragraph: The City Council speaker, Christine C. Quinn, supports a bid to change the city’s campaign finance rules that the Campaign Finance Board says would create gaping loopholes in the city’s regulations.

headline.seo: Quinn Supports Loosening Rules on Campaign Spending by Unions
headline.main: Quinn Backs Expansion of Campaign Spending
headline.print_headline: Quinn Backs Expansion Of Campaign Spending
